courseSectionInformation: 3 undergraduate hours. 4 graduate hours. Approved for letter and S/U grading. Prerequisite: Admission to MSW program or consent of instructor.
description: Introduces students to the problem of substance abuse and its impact on society. Examines the physiological, psychological, social, and cultural aspects of substance abuse. At the individual and familial levels, the course examines the causes, development, prevention, and treatment of substance abuse. At the societal level, the course examines public policy efforts to regular and control substance use from both historical and contemporary perspective. Implications for social and economic justice are also examined. 3 undergraduate hours. 4 graduate hours. Approved for letter and S/U grading. Prerequisite: Admission to MSW program or consent of instructor.
label: Subst Use in Social Context
sectionRegistrationNotes: Not intended for students with Freshman or Sophomore class standing.
